results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.

results.title: The Industrious flame
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, Ace Films, British Gas Council and John Miller
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that heat is essential in practically all industries to process raw materials. States that gas is one of the most economical sources of heat and shows its use in the pottery, steel sheet, baking and electric globes industries.

results.title: The Industrial revolution: beginnings in the United States
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Dennis Azzarella and Lee Kohns
results.brief_description: Traces the explosive growth of the Inudstrial Revolution in the United States - beginning with a thread mill built in 1791, followed by the first modern factory in history. Explains how labor-saving machines, mass production techniques, rapid communication devices increased the standard of living and how the development of fast transportation made the whole continent a market place. Part of the Rise of Industrial America series.

results.title: The Industrial revolution
results.brief_description: Primitive humans employed animals to supplement their own strength and labour power, and this method of production has been common to all civilizations. Technological development which went hand in hand with the increase in the complexity of European civilization, particularly the development of machines, gradually replaced the labour-power of men and draught animals in many aspects of production. The social and economic implications of industrialisation are noted.

results.title: The Industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: Hugh Baddeley Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: The story of the industrial developments that transformed the cottage industries of the eighteenth century into the power-driven factories of the nineteenth century. Describes development of the steam-engine, inventions in the textile industry and developments in communications and transport.

results.title: The Industrial city
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hermann D. Tauchert
results.brief_description: Uses a case study of the industrial city of Detroit in order to present a view of the function of the industrial community in modern American society. Emphasises the fact that the future of a city depends on the education, training and ability of the people. Also discusses the automobile industry where 10,000 cars are produced per day at this time. Touches on the problems of traffic congestion, pollution, poverty and clime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Hermann D. Tauchert

results.title: The Individual in the modern world
results.brief_description: The Corning Foundation and the American Council of Learned Societies in 1961 co-sponsored a second Corning conference on the theme “The Individual and the modern world”. Distinguished Americans and other world figures held informal sessions on work, education and leisure. These far ranging discussions became the subject for this film.

results.title: The Individual
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions in methods of preventing communicable diseases associated with improper food handling. Illustrates habits that should be avoided by cooks and waitresses including dirty clothes and hands, untidy hair, and handling of the eating surface of crockery and cutlery.

results.title: The Indian elephant
results.brief_description: Catching and training a young work elephant. The life of the herd in the jungle; digging a pit trap over a forest path; moving the trapped elephant; the elephant overcomes his fear and submits to training; finally it is seen loading logs on to railway trucks.
results.description: Catching and training a young work elephant. The life of the herd in the jungle; digging a pit trap over a forest path; moving the trapped elephant; the elephant overcomes his fear and submits to training; finally it is seen loading logs on to railway trucks.

results.title: The Indian army
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes a tour of the modern Indian army, paying special attention to a regiment that was once known as the First Bengal Lancers.
